steps.title: Ensure Safety
steps.description: Remove the person from the source of heat and make sure the area is safe.

steps.title: Cool the Burn
steps.description: Run cool (not cold) water over the burn for 10â€“20 minutes.

steps.title: Remove Tight Items
steps.description: Take off rings, watches, or tight clothing near the burned area before swelling starts.

steps.title: Protect the Burn
steps.description: Cover the burn with a sterile, non-stick bandage or clean cloth.

steps.title: Avoid Ointments
steps.description: Do not apply butter, oils, toothpaste, or ice directly to the burn.

steps.title: Seek Medical Help
steps.description: Call emergency services if the burn is severe, large, or on the face, joints, or sensitive areas.
